title: Sam Kerr on target as holders Chelsea cruise into Adobe Women FA Cup fifth round
body_text:
Sam Kerrâ€™s brace provided holders Chelsea with safe passage to the fifth round proper of the Adobe Womenâ€™s FA Cup as they won 5-0 against Crystal Palace at Kingsmeadow.
Kerr, who scored the winner in both the 2022 and 2023 finals of the competition, showed her clinical edge in front of goal once more, bagging Chelseaâ€™s second and fourth.
And both Barclays Womenâ€™s Super League sides proved too strong for their WSL 2 opponents as Wassa SangarÃ© proved the difference for London City Lionesses in a 1-0 victory away at Sunderland.
It marked Eder Maestreâ€™s first win as head coach of the London outfit, having replaced Jocelyn PrÃªcheur over the winter break.
But the victory did not come easy at Eppleton Colliery Football Ground as Sunderland, who sit eighth in WSL 2, made London City work for a spot in the fifth round.
The hosts had the best chance of the first half as Rhiannon Roberts saw her effort deflected over the bar, as the visitors struggled to convert their possessional dominance into chances.
But it did not take long to make one of their many corners count after the break as Grace Geyoroâ€™s corner was headed home brilliantly by SangarÃ© on 50 minutes.
DaniÃ«lle van de Donk came on to make her debut with 20 minutes to go and Maestre will hope the victory can spark a revival in form.

In the second of Saturdayâ€™s matches, Chelsea showed no such hesitation in front of goal as Millie Bright got the hosts off to a flying start after just 13 minutes.
The defender latched onto Erin Cuthbertâ€™s inch-perfect cross to turn home before the Scottish midfielder added a second assist ten minutes later.
This time it was a brilliant through-ball to send Kerr through to add Chelseaâ€™s second.
Guro Reiten then made it three before the break, as she converted from the spot having been fouled in the box.
And the Blues did not let up after the break as Reiten turned provider to deliver a cross for Kerr to turn home before Alyssa Thompson completed the scoring on 70 minutes.
